main_definition: Don is a slang term used to express approval, agreement or encouragement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give (a person) money as a reward for performing work that one could do themselves. Also known as 'dong'.
meanings_and_examples.example: I don't want to pay someone else to mow my lawn, but if I have no choice, I might have to 'don' the job.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To provide money for a good cause or event. This is often used in the context of fundraising.
meanings_and_examples.example: The local community decided to donate money for the construction of a new playground.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A colloquial term meaning 'do it' or encouraging someone to take action. Often used in British English and other regions, similar phrases may vary.
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Don't worry about the presentation; you can do it! Just give your best effort.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: A traditional Scottish garment worn by men as part of formal attire. The term is also used informally to refer to any loose-fitting, knee-length garment.
meanings_and_examples.example: 'He wore a don on top of his suit for the wedding.'
